definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things

sentences.english: You need a spoon to beat the mixture smooth.
sentences.chinese: 你需要用一把調羹來攪均混合液。

sentences.english: She stirred her coffee with a spoon.
Before washing the clothes, froth up the soap mixture.
sentences.chinese: 洗衣之前先把皁液攪起泡沫。

sentences.english: The little man stirred the coals again and blew on them to make them burn brighter.
sentences.chinese: 小個子又攪了攪煤渣並吹着氣讓它們燃燒得更旺一點。

sentences.english: The little man stirred the coals again and blew on them to make them burn brighter.
sentences.chinese: 小個子又攪了攪煤渣並吹着氣讓它們燃燒得更旺一點。

sentences.english: Instead, chew on a drinking straw or a coffee stirrer.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以，考慮一下飲料吸管或者攪咖啡的杓子。

sentences.english: The churn revolved as usual, but the butter would not come.
sentences.chinese: 攪黃油的機器照常運轉着，但是黃油就是攪不出來。

sentences.english: The ship churned the water up as it passed.
sentences.chinese: 輪船駛過時，把水攪得波浪翻滾。

sentences.english: Sucre reluctantly takes the egg beater and begins to drill.
sentences.chinese: Sucre不情願地拿着攪蛋器開始鑽洞。

sentences.english: You can even add drops of hand-wash gel to the water and stir it, before dipping your hands in it.
sentences.chinese: 在泡手前，在裏邊加點洗手液然後攪一攪當然更好。

sentences.english: You can even add drops of hand-wash gel to the water and stir it, before dipping your hands in it.
sentences.chinese: 在泡手前，在裏邊加點洗手液然後攪一攪當然更好。

sentences.english: Blend chopped basil, oil, and vinegar in mini processor until most of basil is pureed.
sentences.chinese: 將紫蘇，橄欖油和白醋放進攪拌機中攪打成泥。

sentences.english: But it’s also had the unintended effect of driving rural pharmacies out of business.
sentences.chinese: 但也意外地攪了鄉村藥房的生意。

sentences.english: It seemed that the papers were trying to stir it up, rubbishing him, blaming him.
sentences.chinese: 但看起來媒體總是想攪起事端，詆譭他，責備他。

sentences.english: Turning around, he waved at Ken, further riling him.
sentences.chinese: 回過頭，他在肯恩，進一步的把攪渾濁他揮舞。

sentences.english: Once the custard coats the back of a spoon, stir into the cooled caramel.
sentences.chinese: 一旦牛奶沙司能裹住勺子背後了就攪進冷焦糖。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to dispatch sb to do sth/to make sb leave/to pass (the time)/(old) to make arrangements/(old) to bestow (alms etc)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
